s0047.chinese: 徒中壯士願從諸十餘人。
s0047.literal: Among the convicts there were sturdy warriors who wished to follow him, more than ten people.
s0047.idiomatic: Among the convicts were over a dozen strong men who wanted to follow him.

s0048.chinese: 高祖被酒，夜徑澤中，令一人行前。
s0048.literal: Gaozu was drunk, at night he went directly through the marsh, ordered one person to walk ahead.
s0048.idiomatic: Gaozu was drunk and walking through the marsh at night when he sent one man ahead to scout.

s0049.literal: The one walking ahead returned and reported saying: '

s0050.literal: Ahead there is a large snake blocking the path, I wish to return.'
s0050.idiomatic: There's a huge snake blocking the path ahead. I want to turn back.'

s0051.literal: Gaozu drunk, said: 'A warrior walks, what is there to fear!'
s0051.idiomatic: Gaozu, still drunk, said, 'A real man keeps going! What's there to fear?'

s0052.literal: Then he went forward, drew his sword and cut the snake.
s0052.idiomatic: He went forward, drew his sword, and slashed the snake in two.

s0053.literal: The snake divided into two, the path opened.
s0053.idiomatic: The snake split in two, clearing the path.

s0054.literal: They walked several li, drunk and tired he lay down.
s0054.idiomatic: They walked a few miles before Gaozu, exhausted and still drunk, collapsed and fell asleep.

s0055.chinese: 後人來至蛇所，有一老嫗夜哭。
s0055.literal: Later people came to the snake's location, there was an old woman crying at night.
s0055.idiomatic: Later, when people came to where the snake had been, they found an old woman crying in the night.

s0056.chinese: 人問嫗何哭，嫗曰：「人殺吾子。」
s0056.literal: People asked the old woman why she cried, the old woman said: 'Someone killed my son.'
s0056.idiomatic: Someone asked the old woman why she was crying. 'A man killed my son,' she replied.

s0057.literal: People said: 'Old woman's son why was he killed?'
s0057.idiomatic: They asked, 'How did your son get killed?'

s0058.chinese: 嫗曰：「吾子，白帝子也，化為蛇，當道，今者赤帝子斬 之，故哭。」
s0058.literal: The old woman said: 'My son is the son of the White Emperor, transformed into a snake, blocked the path, now the son of the Red Emperor cut it, therefore I cry.'
s0058.idiomatic: The old woman said, 'My son was the child of the White Emperor. He transformed into a snake to block the path, but now the child of the Red Emperor has slain him. That's why I'm crying.'

s0059.chinese: 人乃以嫗為不誠，欲苦之，嫗因忽不見。
s0059.literal: People then took the old woman as not sincere, wanted to harm her, the old woman therefore suddenly disappeared.
s0059.idiomatic: The people thought she was lying and wanted to punish her, but she suddenly vanished.

s0060.idiomatic: When others arrived later, Gaozu woke up.

s0061.chinese: 告高祖，高祖乃心獨喜，自負。
s0061.literal: They told Gaozu, Gaozu then in his heart alone was happy, considered himself outstanding.
s0061.idiomatic: They told Gaozu what happened, and he was secretly delighted, feeling quite pleased with himself.

s0062.literal: The various followers increasingly feared him.
s0062.idiomatic: His followers grew increasingly awed by him.

s0063.chinese: 秦始皇帝嘗曰「東南有天子氣」，於是東游以猒當之。
s0063.literal: Qin Shihuang once said 'There is emperor aura in the southeast', therefore he toured east to repress it.
s0063.idiomatic: Qin Shihuang once said there was 'imperial aura' in the southeast, so he traveled east to suppress it.

s0064.chinese: 高祖隱於芒、碭山澤間，呂后與人俱求，常得之。
s0064.literal: Gaozu hid in the mountains and marshes between Mang and Dang, Empress Lü together with people sought him, often found him.
s0064.idiomatic: Gaozu hid in the mountains and marshes between Mang and Dang counties. Empress Lü searched for him with others and always found him.

s0065.idiomatic: Gaozu asked curiously how she always found him.

s0066.chinese: 呂后曰：「季所居上常有雲氣，故從往常得季。」
s0066.literal: Empress Lü said: 'Above where Ji resides there is often cloud qi, therefore following it I always find Ji.'
s0066.idiomatic: Empress Lü replied, 'There's always a cloud of auspicious vapor above wherever you hide. I just follow that cloud and it leads me right to you.'

s0068.chinese: 沛中子弟或聞之，多欲附者矣。
s0068.literal: Pei middle young men some heard of it, many desired to attach themselves.
s0068.idiomatic: When some young men from Pei heard about this, many wanted to join him.

s0069.literal: Therefore Fan Kuai followed Gaozu and came.
s0069.idiomatic: This is when Fan Kuai came to join Gaozu.

s0070.chinese: 沛令後悔，恐其有變，乃閉城城守，欲誅蕭、曹。
s0070.literal: The Pei magistrate afterwards regretted, feared there would be change, therefore closed the city and defended it, wanted to execute Xiao and Cao.
s0070.idiomatic: The magistrate of Pei now regretted his decision. Fearing trouble, he sealed the city gates and prepared to execute Xiao He and Cao Shen.

s0071.literal: Xiao and Cao were afraid, climbed over the wall to protect Gaozu.
s0071.idiomatic: Xiao He and Cao Shen, terrified, climbed over the city wall to join Gaozu.

s0072.chinese: 高祖乃書 帛射城上，與沛父老曰：「天下同苦秦久矣。
s0072.literal: Gaozu then wrote on silk and shot it onto the city wall, telling the Pei elders: 'The realm together has suffered under Qin for a long time.
s0072.idiomatic: Gaozu wrote a message on silk, shot it over the city wall, and addressed the elders of Pei: 'All under heaven have suffered long under Qin tyranny.

s0073.chinese: 今父老雖為沛令守，諸侯並起，今屠沛。
s0073.literal: Now although elders defend for the Pei magistrate, the feudal lords all rise, now they will slaughter Pei.
s0073.idiomatic: Though you defend the magistrate now, the other lords are rising up. They'll slaughter everyone in Pei.

s0074.chinese: 沛今共誅令，擇可立立之，以應諸侯，即室家完。
s0074.literal: Pei now together execute the magistrate, choose someone suitable to establish, to respond to the feudal lords, then families will be complete.
s0074.idiomatic: If Pei executes the magistrate together and chooses a worthy leader to join the other lords, your families will be safe.

s0075.chinese: 不然，父子俱屠，無為 也。」
s0075.literal: If not, fathers and sons will all be slaughtered, useless.'
s0075.idiomatic: Otherwise, we'll all be massacred—fathers, sons, everyone. There's no point in that.'

s0076.chinese: 父老乃帥子弟共殺沛令，開城門迎高祖，欲以為沛令。
s0076.literal: The elders then led their young men together to kill the Pei magistrate, opened the city gates to welcome Gaozu, wished to make him Pei magistrate.
s0076.idiomatic: The elders rallied their sons and young men, killed the magistrate, opened the gates, and welcomed Gaozu, wanting to make him magistrate of Pei.

s0077.chinese: 高祖曰：「天下方擾，諸侯並起，令置將不善，一敗塗地。
s0077.literal: Gaozu said: 'The realm is currently in chaos, feudal lords all rising, appointing generals poorly, one defeat covers the ground.
s0077.idiomatic: Gaozu said, 'The empire is in turmoil with lords rising everywhere. If I appoint the wrong commanders, one defeat will destroy everything.

s0078.chinese: 吾非敢自愛，恐能薄，不能完父兄子弟。
s0078.literal: I do not dare to love myself, fear my abilities are thin, cannot protect fathers, elder brothers, younger brothers.
s0078.idiomatic: I'm not trying to save myself—I just fear my abilities are limited and I can't protect all our families.'

s0079.chinese: 此 大事，願吏擇可者。」
s0079.literal: This is a great matter, I wish officials choose the suitable one.'
s0079.idiomatic: This is a grave responsibility. Please, officials, choose someone capable.'

s0080.chinese: 蕭、曹等皆文吏，自愛，恐事不就，後秦種族其家，盡讓高祖。
s0080.literal: Xiao, Cao and others all were civil officials, loved themselves, feared affairs would not succeed, afterwards Qin would exterminate their families, all yielded to Gaozu.
s0080.idiomatic: Xiao He, Cao Shen and the other civil officials, fearing failure and Qin reprisals against their families, all declined and urged Gaozu to take the position.

s0081.chinese: 諸父老皆曰：「平生所聞劉季奇怪，當貴，且卜筮之，莫如劉季最吉。」
s0081.literal: All the elders said: 'What we have heard in our lives about Liu Ji is strange, he should be noble, moreover divining it, none is as auspicious as Liu Ji.'
s0081.idiomatic: All the elders said, 'Throughout our lives we've heard strange tales about Liu Ji. He is destined for greatness. Even divination shows no one more auspicious than Liu Ji.'

s0083.chinese: 眾莫肯為，高祖乃立為沛公。
s0083.literal: The crowd none would do it, Gaozu then was established as Pei Lord.
s0083.idiomatic: No one else would accept, so Gaozu was established as Lord of Pei.

s0084.chinese: 祠黃帝，祭蚩尤於沛廷，而釁鼓旗。
s0084.literal: Sacrificed to the Yellow Emperor, offered to Chi You in the Pei court, and smeared the drums and banners with blood.
s0084.idiomatic: He sacrificed to the Yellow Emperor and Chi You in the Pei courthouse, then consecrated the drums and banners with blood.

s0085.chinese: 幟皆赤，由所殺蛇白帝子，所殺者赤帝子故也。
s0085.literal: The banners all were red, because the killed snake was White Emperor's son, the killer was Red Emperor's son therefore.
s0085.idiomatic: All banners were red, symbolizing that he who killed the White Emperor's son (the snake) was himself the Red Emperor's son.

s0086.chinese: 於是少年豪吏如蕭、曹、樊噲等皆為收沛子 弟，得三千人。
s0086.literal: Therefore young heroic officials like Xiao, Cao, Fan Kuai and others all recruited Pei young men, obtained three thousand.
s0086.idiomatic: Young officials like Xiao He, Cao Shen, and Fan Kuai recruited three thousand young men from Pei.

s0087.chinese: 是月，項梁與兄子羽起吳。
s0087.literal: This month, Xiang Liang and his brother's son Yu rose in Wu.
s0087.idiomatic: That month, Xiang Liang and his nephew Xiang Yu rose up in Wu.

s0088.chinese: 田儋與從弟榮、橫起齊，自立為齊王。
s0088.literal: Tian Dan and his younger cousin Rong, Heng rose in Qi, established themselves as King of Qi.
s0088.idiomatic: Tian Dan and his cousins Tian Rong and Tian Heng rose up in Qi and proclaimed themselves King of Qi.

s0089.literal: Han Guang established himself as King of Yan.
s0089.idiomatic: Han Guang proclaimed himself King of Yan.

s0090.literal: Wei Jiu established himself as King of Wei.
s0090.idiomatic: Wei Jiu proclaimed himself King of Wei.

s0091.chinese: 陳涉之將周章西入關，至戲，秦將章邯距破之。
s0091.literal: Chen Sheng's general Zhou Zhang entered the passes westward, reached Xi, Qin general Zhang Han resisted and defeated him.
s0091.idiomatic: Chen Sheng's general Zhou Zhang marched west through the passes and reached Xi, where Qin general Zhang Han defeated him.

s0092.chinese: 秦二年十月，沛公攻胡陵、方與，還守豐。
s0092.literal: Qin second year tenth month, Pei Lord attacked Hu Ling and Fang Yu, returned to defend Feng.
s0092.idiomatic: In the tenth month of the second year of Qin, Lord Pei attacked Hu Ling and Fang Yu, then returned to defend Feng.

s0093.literal: Qin Sishui commandery overseer Ping led troops to surround Feng.
s0093.idiomatic: The Qin overseer of Sishui commandery, Ping, led troops to besiege Feng.

s0094.literal: Two days, went out and fought with them, defeated them.
s0094.idiomatic: Two days later, they sallied forth and defeated the besiegers.

s0095.literal: Ordered Yong Chi to defend Feng.
s0095.idiomatic: He ordered Yong Chi to defend Feng.

s0096.chinese: 十 一月，沛公引兵之薜。
s0096.literal: Eleventh month, Pei Lord led troops to Xi.
s0096.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Lord Pei led his troops to Xi.

s0097.chinese: 秦泗川守壯兵敗於薛，走至戚，沛公左司馬得殺之。
s0097.literal: Qin Sishui defender Zhuang's troops were defeated at Xue, fled to Qi, Pei Lord's left marshal captured and killed him.
s0097.idiomatic: The Qin defender of Sishui, Zhuang, was defeated at Xue and fled to Qi, where Lord Pei's left marshal captured and executed him.

s0098.literal: Pei Lord returned his army to Kangfu, arrived at Fangyu.
s0098.idiomatic: Lord Pei withdrew his army to Kangfu, then proceeded to Fangyu.

s0099.literal: Zhao King Wu Chen was killed by his general.
s0099.idiomatic: King Wu Chen of Zhao was assassinated by one of his generals.
